description.narrative:
The Northeast Research and Social Work Networking (NERSWN), Kokrajhar, is one of the responsive voluntary organization operating inthe region. The organization is registered under Section XXI of Society Registration Act of 1860, FCRA 1976 and Section 12A of IT Act 1961. The organization was conceived by a group of young people who were together known as ‘BRANSTHU’ in December 2004 and was registered as a society in June 2005. Presently, the organization is operating from its Headquarter at Kokrajhar, Assam with its project offices located at Gossaigaon and Kazigaon, sub-divisions in the district of Kokrajhar. Currently, the organization is working mainly in the Bodoland region of Assam with a group of people who have experienced exclusion from the developmental discourse, with anaim to realize sustainable development and create equitable opportunities.
Based on the recent FCRA issues Oxfam India has suggested engaging 2 partners in India to complete the project activities. Northeast Research and Social Work Networking (NERSWN) and Grameen Development Services (GDS) have beenapart of the TROSA program since year 1. They were part of Oxfam India in the past but now the partnership will be directly from ONL/PMU. We have approached the donor on the changes. Sida has approved the changes. Key con]tribution from Local CSOs including GDS are Civil society organizations: CSOs enable citizens to raise their voice, provide evidence-based alternatives and advocate for change. Where political space is lacking, CSOs working in partnership with local governments can influence water resource decision-making. Work may often be coordinated through alliances of like-minded groups, or working in formalized or informal networks. These will often include nongovernment organisations working collaboratively with combinations of researchers, policy institutions and universities, media, community based and peoples organisations. Drawing together diverse skills sets and interests, they are able to analyze water related issues at different scales that can provide evidence which can be a starting point for dialogue with decision makers, be used to hold duty bearers accountable, and also provide scientific evidence for policy andpractice alternatives or interventions

participating-org.narrative: NorthEast Research&SocialWork Netwo NorthEast Research&SocialWork Netwo

The North East Research <(>&<)> Social Work Networking (NERSWN) is a secular, not-for-profit, gender-just, non-political organization set up in 2004 and registered in 2005 under the Societies Registration Act 1860. NERSWN is a responsive voluntary institutionsconceived, led and managed by a bunch of committed <(>&<)> dynamic young people from the region, working towards sustainable <(>&<)> holistic change mainly in the North East region of India. We, at NERSWN, seek to reach out with social endeavour to the doorsteps of people, to realize development <(>&<)> rights of the marginalized by building capacities of communities and strengthening knowledge technology <(>&<)> networks.

description.narrative: Communities innovate and implement locally owned solutions for climate adaptation and resilience, with recognition of the specific needs and aspirations of women, men and youth.
CBOs and NGO's resourced to innovate and implement locally owned solutions, recognizing specific needs and aspirations of women, men and youth

CBOs, producer organisations, NGO and other civil society actors with strengthened capacities to advocate and to increase people's voice in decisions on policies regarding agriculture production systems, land scape management and market systems
local communities, CBOs and small holder organisations that promote innovative locally owned solutions, recognizing and promoting gender equality and women and youth leadership
